citation.article-title: Legionella impletisoli sp. nov. and Legionella yabuuchiae sp. nov., isolated from soils contaminated with industrial wastes in Japan.

p.s: Description of Legionella impletisoli sp. nov.
im.ple.ti.so’li. L. neut. part. adj. impletum filled/filled-in, L. gen. neut. n. soli of/from soil, N. L. gen. neut. n. impletisoli of/from filled-in soil, from landfill.
Gram-negative rod, grows on BCYEα agar, but not on media without l-cysteine.

Positive for oxidase activity, catalase activity, hydrolysis of hippurate and browning of tyrosine-supplemented agar; negative for reduction of nitrate to nitrite, urease, utilization of glucose, and gelatinase activity.
Contains the saturated fatty acids C15:0 ANTEISO (22.31%), C16:0 ISO (21.78%) and C17:0 ANTEISO (19.33%) as the major fatty acid components.
This species was isolated from soils contaminated with industrial wastes collected from a landfill in Osaka, Japan.
The type strain is strain OA1-1.
It has a G+C content of 40.5%.
